CheckpointSettings.description: Configuration for automatic session checkpoint saving during long-running workflows.

autoSaveOnCompact.description: Whether to automatically save a checkpoint when context compaction occurs.
autoSaveOnCompact.title: Auto-Save on Compact

enabled.description: Whether automatic checkpoint saving is enabled.
enabled.title: Enable Checkpoints

filenamePattern.description: Template pattern for checkpoint filenames. Supports placeholders: {YYMMDD}, {HHMM}, {slug}.
filenamePattern.title: Filename Pattern

intervalMinutes.description: Minimum interval in minutes between automatic checkpoint saves.
intervalMinutes.title: Interval (Minutes)

path.description: Directory path (relative to project root) where checkpoint files are saved.
path.title: Checkpoint Path

CheckpointSettings.title: Checkpoint Settings

CommandMappingEntry.description: Maps a logical command key to platform-specific command invocations for Claude Code and GitHub Copilot.

claude.description: Claude Code slash command (must start with /).
claude.title: Claude Code Command

copilot.description: GitHub Copilot slash command (must start with /).
copilot.title: Copilot Command

CommandMappingEntry.title: Command Mapping Entry

PreActions.description: Actions to perform before starting the workflow sequence. Used to load skills, inject context, or pre-read files.

activateSkill.description: Name of the skill to activate before workflow execution (e.g., 'product-owner', 'qa-engineer').
activateSkill.title: Activate Skill

injectContext.description: Context text to inject into the agent's prompt before workflow execution. Typically contains workflow-specific instructions or checklists.
injectContext.title: Inject Context

readFiles.description: List of file paths (relative to project root) to read before workflow execution. Used to pre-load templates, guides, or reference documents.
readFiles.title: Read Files

PreActions.title: Pre-Actions

Settings.description: Global configuration for workflow detection, overrides, and checkpoint behavior.

allowOverride.description: Whether users can bypass workflow detection using the override prefix.
allowOverride.title: Allow Override

confirmHighImpact.description: Whether to prompt for user confirmation before executing workflows marked with confirmFirst: true.
confirmHighImpact.title: Confirm High Impact

enabled.description: Master toggle to enable or disable all workflow detection and automation.
enabled.title: Enable Workflows

overridePrefix.description: Prefix string that users type to bypass automatic workflow detection (e.g., 'quick:').
overridePrefix.title: Override Prefix

showDetection.description: Whether to display the detected intent and workflow sequence to the user before execution.
showDetection.title: Show Detection

Settings.title: Global Settings

WorkflowEntry.description: Defines a workflow selected by AI-native intent detection. Contains natural language descriptions for when to use/not use, an ordered sequence of commands, and optional pre-actions.

confirmFirst.description: Whether to ask for user confirmation before starting this workflow. Recommended for high-impact workflows (feature, refactor, release).
confirmFirst.title: Confirm Before Execution

description.description: Detailed description of what this workflow does and when it is triggered.
description.title: Workflow Description

enableCheckpoints.description: Whether to save periodic checkpoints during this workflow. Recommended for long-running workflows.
enableCheckpoints.title: Enable Checkpoints

name.description: Human-readable display name for the workflow, shown to users during detection.
name.title: Workflow Name

sequence.description: Ordered list of command keys (referencing commandMapping) to execute. Commands run in sequence from first to last.
sequence.title: Command Sequence

whenNotToUse.description: Natural language description of when NOT to select this workflow. Used for disambiguation when multiple workflows could match.
whenNotToUse.title: When Not To Use

whenToUse.description: Natural language description of when the AI should select this workflow. The AI model reads this to decide which workflow matches the user's intent.
examples: User reports a bug, error, crash, broken functionality, or asks to fix/debug/troubleshoot an issue.
User wants to implement, add, create, or build a new feature or functionality.
whenToUse.title: When To Use

WorkflowEntry.title: Workflow Definition

description: Schema for Claude Code and GitHub Copilot workflow automation configuration. Defines AI-native intent detection, command mapping, and workflow sequences for AI agent orchestration.

$schema.description: Path or URL to the JSON Schema file for IDE validation and autocompletion.
$schema.title: Schema Reference

commandMapping.description: Maps logical command keys to platform-specific command strings for Claude Code and GitHub Copilot. Each key is referenced by workflow sequences.
commandMapping.title: Command Mapping

description.description: Human-readable description of this workflow configuration file.
description.title: Configuration Description

version.description: Semantic version of the workflow configuration (e.g., 2.0.0).
version.title: Configuration Version

workflows.description: Named workflow definitions selected by AI-native intent detection. Each workflow has natural language whenToUse/whenNotToUse descriptions that the AI reads to determine which workflow matches the user's intent.
workflows.title: Workflow Definitions

title: EasyPlatform Workflow Configuration
